clusters.title: Trump says he has received assurances ‘killing in Iran is stopping’
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says ‘we’ve been told killing has stopped’ in Iran

items.title: Trump says he has received assurances ‘killing in Iran is stopping’
items.standfirst: President declines to rule out military action after Washington evacuated personnel from Qatar command centre
items.content: President declines to rule out military action after Washington evacuated personnel from Qatar command centre

items.title: Trump says Iran has told him ‘killing has stopped’ as he pulls back from strike threats
items.standfirst: US president says he has been assured by Tehran ‘there’s no plan for executions’ of protesters Iran protests – live updatesIran crisis explained: what we know so farAnalysis: why western diplomats are wary of predicting regime’s end daysDonald Trump has at least temporarily pulled back from threats to strike Iran, saying he has been assured the killing of protesters has been halted and no executions are being planned.Speaking to reporters in the White House on Wednesday night, the US president said: “We’ve been told that the killing in Iran is stopping – it’s stopped – it’s stopping. And there’s no plan for executions, or an execution, or execution – so I’ve been told that on good authority.” He offered no details and said the US had yet to verify the claims. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says he has been assured by Tehran ‘there’s no plan for executions’ of protesters Iran protests – live updatesIran crisis explained: what we know so farAnalysis: why western diplomats are wary of predicting regime’s end daysDonald Trump has at least temporarily pulled back from threats to strike Iran, saying he has been assured the killing of protesters has been halted and no executions are being planned.Speaking to reporters in the White House on Wednesday night, the US president said: “We’ve been told that the killing in Iran is stopping – it’s stopped – it’s stopping. And there’s no plan for executions, or an execution, or execution – so I’ve been told that on good authority.” He offered no details and said the US had yet to verify the claims. Continue reading...

items.title: European Gas Price Rises on Supply-Disruption Fears, Stronger Asia Demand
items.standfirst: European natural-gas prices rose as unrest in Iran raises concerns about potential disruptions to global markets, despite easing fears of imminent U.S. action against Tehran.
items.content: European natural-gas prices rose as unrest in Iran raises concerns about potential disruptions to global markets, despite easing fears of imminent U.S. action against Tehran.

items.title: Iran officials deny detained shopkeeper Erfan Soltani facing execution
items.standfirst: Iranian shopkeeper Erfan Soltani is among thousands of people who were feared to be facing death sentences, but after a warning from President Trump, officials claim he never was.
items.content: Iranian shopkeeper Erfan Soltani is among thousands of people who were feared to be facing death sentences, but after a warning from President Trump, officials claim he never was.

items.title: Iran: Donald Trump says killings have halted after anti-government protests
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he’s been told "on good authority" that plans for executions in Iran have stopped. Tehran, on its end, has signaled fast trials and executions ahead in its crackdown on protesters. Story by Charlotte Hughes and Eliza Herbert.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he’s been told "on good authority" that plans for executions in Iran have stopped. Tehran, on its end, has signaled fast trials and executions ahead in its crackdown on protesters. Story by Charlotte Hughes and Eliza Herbert.

items.title: Oil prices fall 3% after Trump says ‘killing has stopped’ in Iran
items.standfirst: Concerns about a U.S. strike on Iran had been mounting after Trump vowed to take action against the regime’s crackdown on widespread protests in the country.
items.content: Concerns about a U.S. strike on Iran had been mounting after Trump vowed to take action against the regime’s crackdown on widespread protests in the country.

items.title: Oil Slides on Easing Fears of Imminent U.S. Action Against Iran
items.standfirst: Oil prices fell 3% in early trading after Trump said Iran had stopped killing antiregime protesters, easing concerns over imminent military action against the country.
items.content: Oil prices fell 3% in early trading after Trump said Iran had stopped killing antiregime protesters, easing concerns over imminent military action against the country.

items.title: Trump says ‘we’ve been told killing has stopped’ in Iran

items.content: A day after warning of ‘serious consequences,’ Trump said he had been told the killing of protesters in Iran had stopped

items.title: Trump told 'killing has stopped' in Iran after violent protest crackdown
items.standfirst: The US president does not rule out military action in Iran, as Tehran temporarily shuts its airspace to nearly all flights.
items.content: The US president does not rule out military action in Iran, as Tehran temporarily shuts its airspace to nearly all flights.

items.title: What's next in Iran after Trump says killing of protesters "has stopped"
items.standfirst: President Trump says his administration has been notified that the killings and executions of anti-government protesters in Iran have stopped. CBS News Middle East reporter Courtney Kealy has more.
items.content: President Trump says his administration has been notified that the killings and executions of anti-government protesters in Iran have stopped. CBS News Middle East reporter Courtney Kealy has more.

items.title: Trump says Iran executions ‘stopping’ as Tehran signals fast trials and hangings
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump claimed on Wednesday that executions in Iran may have been halted, citing unnamed sources, even as the Iranian government intensified warnings of rapid trials and possible executions for thousands of detainees amid ongoing protests.
items.content: President Donald Trump claimed on Wednesday that executions in Iran may have been halted, citing unnamed sources, even as the Iranian government intensified warnings of rapid trials and possible executions for thousands of detainees amid ongoing protests.

items.title: Iranian death toll reaches 2,000, rights group says, as Trump tells protesters 'help is on the way'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump urged Iranian civilians to keep protesting and said “help is on its way” Tuesday amid a crackdown on anti-government demonstrations that a U.S.-based human rights group says has killed 2,500 people
items.content: President Donald Trump urged Iranian civilians to keep protesting and said “help is on its way” Tuesday amid a crackdown on anti-government demonstrations that a U.S.-based human rights group says has killed 2,500 people

clusters.title: Another ICE shooting fuels chaos in Minneapolis
clusters.neutral_headline: Federal agent shoots Minneapolis man in leg after attack, officials say

items.title: Another ICE shooting fuels chaos in Minneapolis
items.standfirst: A US immigration officer shot and wounded a Venezuelan man fleeing a traffic stop in ⁠Minneapolis on Wednesday, the government said, escalating tension over an unwelcome deployment of militarized federal agents in Minnesota's most populous city. Story by Peter O'Brien.
items.content: A US immigration officer shot and wounded a Venezuelan man fleeing a traffic stop in ⁠Minneapolis on Wednesday, the government said, escalating tension over an unwelcome deployment of militarized federal agents in Minnesota's most populous city. Story by Peter O'Brien.

items.standfirst: The agent was acting in self-defence after being attacked with a shovel, said the Department of Homeland Security.
items.content: The agent was acting in self-defence after being attacked with a shovel, said the Department of Homeland Security.

items.title: Protests after man shot during US federal raid in Minneapolis
items.standfirst: Protests erupted in Minneapolis after a federal immigration agent shot a Venezuelan man in the leg after a traffic stop.
items.content: Protests erupted in Minneapolis after a federal immigration agent shot a Venezuelan man in the leg after a traffic stop.

items.title: DHS: ICE officers in Minneapolis shoot Venezuelan man in the leg
items.standfirst: The Department of Homeland Security says the shooting happened after the agent came under attack. Protestors have taken to the streets in Minneapolis, clashing with federal agents, after Renee Macklin Good's killing last week.
items.content: The Department of Homeland Security says the shooting happened after the agent came under attack. Protestors have taken to the streets in Minneapolis, clashing with federal agents, after Renee Macklin Good's killing last week.(Image credit: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán)

items.title: ICE officer shoots man in leg in Minneapolis after shovel attack, officials say
items.standfirst: A shooting occurred Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after ICE officers were attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.
items.content: A shooting occurred Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after ICE officers were attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.

items.title: Federal agent shoots man in Minneapolis as tensions in city run high
items.standfirst: Mayor urged calm as protesters gathered on the scene, as city continues to reel in aftermath of Renee Nicole Good’s killingA federal officer has shot a man in the leg during an enforcement operation in north Minneapolis, sparking protests in a city still on edge after the killing of Renee Nicole Good by a federal agent last week.The shooting occurred about 7pm local time, according to witnesses. Several hundred protesters gathered at the scene on Wednesday night facing off with agents who blocked off the area and used smoke and other crowd control weapons. Continue reading...
items.content: Mayor urged calm as protesters gathered on the scene, as city continues to reel in aftermath of Renee Nicole Good’s killingA federal officer has shot a man in the leg during an enforcement operation in north Minneapolis, sparking protests in a city still on edge after the killing of Renee Nicole Good by a federal agent last week.The shooting occurred about 7pm local time, according to witnesses. Several hundred protesters gathered at the scene on Wednesday night facing off with agents who blocked off the area and used smoke and other crowd control weapons. Continue reading...

items.title: Officials give update after federal officer shoots man in leg in Minneapolis | Special Report
items.standfirst: The Department of Homeland Security says a federal law enforcement officer shot a person in the leg on Wednesday night during an immigration operation in Minneapolis. Minnesota officials provided an update. Jessi Mitchell anchors this Special Report.
items.content: The Department of Homeland Security says a federal law enforcement officer shot a person in the leg on Wednesday night during an immigration operation in Minneapolis. Minnesota officials provided an update. Jessi Mitchell anchors this Special Report.

items.title: Portland man shot by Border Patrol pleads not guilty to assaulting agent
items.standfirst: Luis David Nino-Moncada, shot the day after Renee Good was killed, denies using vehicle as weapon against officerA man shot and wounded by a Border Patrol agent during an immigration stop in Portland last week has plead not guilty to charges of aggravated assault against a federal officer and damaging federal property.Luis David Nino-Moncada, who was taken into custody after sustaining an injury in the arm from the shooting, was indicted on Tuesday and entered his plea on Wednesday. The Department of Homeland Security alleges that Nino-Moncada, who is of Venezuelan descent, entered the US illegally and used his vehicle as a weapon when agents attempted to apprehend him. Continue reading...
items.content: Luis David Nino-Moncada, shot the day after Renee Good was killed, denies using vehicle as weapon against officerA man shot and wounded by a Border Patrol agent during an immigration stop in Portland last week has plead not guilty to charges of aggravated assault against a federal officer and damaging federal property.Luis David Nino-Moncada, who was taken into custody after sustaining an injury in the arm from the shooting, was indicted on Tuesday and entered his plea on Wednesday. The Department of Homeland Security alleges that Nino-Moncada, who is of Venezuelan descent, entered the US illegally and used his vehicle as a weapon when agents attempted to apprehend him. clusters.title: ISS astronauts return to Earth in Nasa’s first ever medical evacuation
clusters.neutral_headline: ISS astronauts return to Earth in Nasa’s first ever medical evacuation

items.title: ISS astronauts return to Earth in Nasa’s first ever medical evacuation
items.standfirst: Four astronauts emerge from capsule after Pacific landing, including crew member in ‘stable’ conditionFour astronauts from the International Space Station have returned to Earth a month earlier than planned after one developed a “serious” medical condition onboard the orbiting outpost.Nasa confirmed the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying the US astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke, the Japanese astronaut Kimiya Yui and Oleg Platonov, a Russian cosmonaut, splashed down at 8.41am UK time off the coast of San Diego. Continue reading...
items.content: Four astronauts emerge from capsule after Pacific landing, including crew member in ‘stable’ conditionFour astronauts from the International Space Station have returned to Earth a month earlier than planned after one developed a “serious” medical condition onboard the orbiting outpost.Nasa confirmed the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying the US astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke, the Japanese astronaut Kimiya Yui and Oleg Platonov, a Russian cosmonaut, splashed down at 8.41am UK time off the coast of San Diego. Continue reading...

items.title: Watch: Astronauts return to Earth after medical evacuation
items.standfirst: Four astronauts who left the International Space Station (ISS) a month early due to one of the crew members falling ill have returned to Earth on Thursday.
items.content: Four astronauts who left the International Space Station (ISS) a month early due to one of the crew members falling ill have returned to Earth on Thursday.

items.title: 4 space station crewmates back on Earth after medical issue cut mission short
items.standfirst: Four space station Crew 11 fliers splashed down off the Southern California coast at 3:41 a.m. ET, closing out a 167-day stay in space cut short by a medical issue.
items.content: Four space station Crew 11 fliers splashed down off the Southern California coast at 3:41 a.m. ET, closing out a 167-day stay in space cut short by a medical issue.

items.title: California Feels Sonic Boom, Fears Earthquake as SpaceX Crew-11 Returns
items.standfirst: Californians were left fearing an earthquake had struck when they felt a sonic boom as NASA's Crew-11 re-entered the Earth's atmosphere aboard their SpaceX Dragon, which was returning early from a mission to the International Space Station (ISS) due to an urgent medical issue with one of the…

items.title: Ailing astronaut returns to Earth early in NASA's first medical evacuation
SpaceX capsule with ailing astronaut, three crewmates splashes down off California
After a medical evacuation from space, NASA's Crew-11 returns to Earth a month early
items.standfirst: Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.
items.content: Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Astronauts splash down on Earth after first-ever ISS medical evacuation
items.standfirst: Four astronauts end their mission early so that a crew member can receive medical treatment.
items.content: Four astronauts end their mission early so that a crew member can receive medical treatment.

items.title: NASA conducts first-ever medical evacuation from space station
items.standfirst: NASA carried out its first medical evacuation from the International Space Station after an astronaut required care, bringing four crew members back to Earth earlier than planned. The early return temporarily reduces the station crew, limiting spacewalks until a replacement team arrives.
items.content: NASA carried out its first medical evacuation from the International Space Station after an astronaut required care, bringing four crew members back to Earth earlier than planned. The early return temporarily reduces the station crew, limiting spacewalks until a replacement team arrives.

clusters.title: NATO allies move troops to Greenland in European military mission
clusters.neutral_headline: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreement' after White House talks on Greenland

items.title: NATO allies move troops to Greenland in European military mission
items.standfirst: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland to help boost the Arctic island's security after talks between representatives of Denmark, Greenland and the US on Wednesday highlighted “fundamental disagreement” between the Trump administration and European allies. Details by FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent, Dave Keating.
items.content: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland to help boost the Arctic island's security after talks between representatives of Denmark, Greenland and the US on Wednesday highlighted “fundamental disagreement” between the Trump administration and European allies. Details by FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent, Dave Keating.

items.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
items.standfirst: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.
items.content: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)

items.title: NATO nations deploy to Greenland after tense White House talks
items.standfirst: Several NATO members are deploying small numbers of troops to Greenland, seeking to shore up the Arctic island's security in the wake of tense talks with the White House about the U.S. desire to annex it. Denmark, which is responsible for Greenland's defense, Germany, France, Sweden, and Norway…
items.content: Several NATO members are deploying small numbers of troops to Greenland, seeking to shore up the Arctic island's security in the wake of tense talks with the White House about the U.S. desire to annex it. Denmark, which is responsible for Greenland's defense, Germany, France, Sweden, and Norway…

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreement' after White House talks on Greenland
items.standfirst: There was no major breakthrough during the meeting, and President Trump reiterated his interest in acquiring the island shortly afterwards.
items.content: There was no major breakthrough during the meeting, and President Trump reiterated his interest in acquiring the island shortly afterwards.

items.title: Trump insists Greenland is crucial for national security after Denmark talks
items.standfirst: Talks fail to solve ‘fundamental disagreement’ over Arctic island controlled by CopenhagenDonald Trump reiterated on Wednesday that the US needs Greenland and that Denmark cannot be relied upon to protect the island, even as he said that “something will work out” with respect to the future governance of the Danish overseas territory.The remarks, which came after a high-stakes meeting between US, Danish and Greenlandic officials, indicate that fundamental differences remain between how Washington, Copenhagen and Nuuk see the political future of the island. Continue reading...
items.content: Talks fail to solve ‘fundamental disagreement’ over Arctic island controlled by CopenhagenDonald Trump reiterated on Wednesday that the US needs Greenland and that Denmark cannot be relied upon to protect the island, even as he said that “something will work out” with respect to the future governance of the Danish overseas territory.The remarks, which came after a high-stakes meeting between US, Danish and Greenlandic officials, indicate that fundamental differences remain between how Washington, Copenhagen and Nuuk see the political future of the island. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreements' over Greenland after White House talks
items.standfirst: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".
items.content: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".

items.title: France to send troops for European security mission to Greenland amid Trump threats
items.standfirst: France and Germany announced Wednesday they will deploy troops to Greenland as part of a European security mission, following renewed threats by US President Donald Trump to take control of the Arctic island. The move, made at Denmark’s request, comes after high-level talks in Washington involving US, Danish and Greenlandic officials.
items.content: France and Germany announced Wednesday they will deploy troops to Greenland as part of a European security mission, following renewed threats by US President Donald Trump to take control of the Arctic island. The move, made at Denmark’s request, comes after high-level talks in Washington involving US, Danish and Greenlandic officials.

items.title: Greenland and Denmark officials meet with Vance and Rubio
items.standfirst: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland met Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio amid President Donald Trump's push to take control of the Arctic island. NBC News' Garrett Haake reports on the meeting's outcome and the officials' current stance regarding Greenland.
items.content: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland met Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio amid President Donald Trump's push to take control of the Arctic island. NBC News' Garrett Haake reports on the meeting's outcome and the officials' current stance regarding Greenland.

clusters.title: Musk's xAI limits Grok's capacity to generate sexualised images
clusters.neutral_headline: Musk’s X to block Grok AI tool from creating sexualised images of real people

items.title: Musk's xAI limits Grok's capacity to generate sexualised images
items.standfirst: Elon Musk's xAI says its Grok AI chatbot will be restricted from generating sexualised images of real people after it was used to create pictures of women and children in varying states of undress. Also in this edition: France's traditional Epiphany cake gets subsidised for Celiac disease sufferers.
items.content: Elon Musk's xAI says its Grok AI chatbot will be restricted from generating sexualised images of real people after it was used to create pictures of women and children in varying states of undress. Also in this edition: France's traditional Epiphany cake gets subsidised for Celiac disease sufferers.

items.title: Philippines to Join Indonesia, Malaysia in Blocking Musk’s Grok
Philippines to Join Indonesia, Malaysia in Blocking Grok AI
items.standfirst: The Philippines will join Malaysia and Indonesia in blocking Elon Musk’s Grok artificial intelligence chatbot amid growing concerns over sexualized images generated by the AI system, according to a top government official.
items.content: The Philippines will join Malaysia and Indonesia in blocking Elon Musk’s Grok artificial intelligence chatbot amid growing concerns over sexualized images generated by the AI system, according to a top government official.

items.title: Musk’s X to block Grok AI tool from creating sexualised images of real people
items.standfirst: UK government claims vindication after Keir Starmer criticised earlier decision to keep functionality as ‘horrific’The UK government has claimed “vindication” after Elon Musk’s X announced it had stopped its AI-powered Grok feature from editing pictures of real people to show them in revealing clothes such as bikinis, including for premium subscribers.After a fortnight of public outcry at the tool embedded into X being used to create sexualised images of women and children, the company said it would “geoblock” the ability of users “to generate images of real people in bikinis, underwear, and similar attire via the Grok account and in Grok in X”, in countries where it was illegal. Continue reading...
items.content: UK government claims vindication after Keir Starmer criticised earlier decision to keep functionality as ‘horrific’The UK government has claimed “vindication” after Elon Musk’s X announced it had stopped its AI-powered Grok feature from editing pictures of real people to show them in revealing clothes such as bikinis, including for premium subscribers.After a fortnight of public outcry at the tool embedded into X being used to create sexualised images of women and children, the company said it would “geoblock” the ability of users “to generate images of real people in bikinis, underwear, and similar attire via the Grok account and in Grok in X”, in countries where it was illegal. Continue reading...

items.title: Elon Musk caves to pressure over Grok deepfake porn scandal

items.content: The AI chatbot’s developer xAI said on Thursday that it’s implementing "technological changes" to restrict users from creating sexualised images of "real people"

items.title: Elon Musk’s X will block Grok AI tool from creating sexualized images in places where it is illegal
items.standfirst: The move came just hours after the billionaire said he was not aware of any “naked underage images” made by Grok. Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok won’t be able to edit photos to portray real people in revealing clothing in places where that is illegal, according to a statement posted on his social…

Elon Musk’s AI chatbot Grok won’t be able to edit photos to portray real people in revealing clothing in places where that is illegal, according to a statement posted on his social…

items.title: xAI restricts Grok chatbot after sexualised AI images spark global concern
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s AI company xAI has imposed limits on its Grok chatbot’s image editing capabilities after hyper-realistic sexualised images – including depictions of minors – circulated online. The restrictions apply to all users, including paid subscribers, and block image generation in jurisdictions where such content is illegal.
items.content: Elon Musk’s AI company xAI has imposed limits on its Grok chatbot’s image editing capabilities after hyper-realistic sexualised images – including depictions of minors – circulated online. The restrictions apply to all users, including paid subscribers, and block image generation in jurisdictions where such content is illegal.

items.title: XAI Blocks Grok From Making Sexualized Images of Real People
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s xAI is disabling the ability for people to use its Grok artificial intelligence chatbot to create sexualized images of real people, following widespread criticism that the company was allowing women and children to be victimized by the tool.
items.content: Elon Musk’s xAI is disabling the ability for people to use its Grok artificial intelligence chatbot to create sexualized images of real people, following widespread criticism that the company was allowing women and children to be victimized by the tool.

clusters.title: Trump suspends immigrant visas for 75 countries: Who’s affected?
clusters.neutral_headline: US suspends immigrant visa processing for 75 countries

items.title: Trump suspends immigrant visas for 75 countries: Who’s affected?
items.standfirst: The suspension will take effect on January 21 but does not apply to visitors or short-term visa holders.
items.content: The suspension will take effect on January 21 but does not apply to visitors or short-term visa holders.

items.title: US suspends immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
items.standfirst: The US on Wednesday said it was issuing a blanket suspension of immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries including Russia, Iran, Brazil, Egypt, Thailand, Nigeria and Somalia. The freeze will begin on January 21 with no set time for it to end.
items.content: The US on Wednesday said it was issuing a blanket suspension of immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries including Russia, Iran, Brazil, Egypt, Thailand, Nigeria and Somalia. The freeze will begin on January 21 with no set time for it to end.

items.standfirst: The US is suspending the process for immigrant visas from 75 countries, the Department of State said on Wednesday.
items.content: The US is suspending the process for immigrant visas from 75 countries, the Department of State said on Wednesday.

items.title: Ukraine: Zelensky declares energy emergency after Russian strikes

items.content: The election is a rematch between Bobi Wine and Yoweri Museveni, who has been president for 40 years.

items.title: Uganda votes for a new president under internet blackout and police crackdown
items.standfirst: Ugandans voted ⁠in a tense national election on Thursday after an often violent campaign and internet shutdown, with President Yoweri Museveni seeking to extend his rule into a fifth decade. Museveni is expected to fend off a challenge from the popular singer Bobi Wine, but the election is a test of the 81-year-old leader's political strength ​and ability to avoid the kind of unrest that has rocked neighbours Tanzania and Kenya. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Uganda, Juliette Montilly.
items.content: Ugandans voted ⁠in a tense national election on Thursday after an often violent campaign and internet shutdown, with President Yoweri Museveni seeking to extend his rule into a fifth decade. Museveni is expected to fend off a challenge from the popular singer Bobi Wine, but the election is a test of the 81-year-old leader's political strength ​and ability to avoid the kind of unrest that has rocked neighbours Tanzania and Kenya. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Uganda, Juliette Montilly.

items.content: Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.(Image credit: Ben Curtis)

clusters.title: Growth figures give boost to Reeves – but it’s too early to get carried away
clusters.neutral_headline: Growth figures give boost to Reeves – but it’s too early to get carried away

items.title: Growth figures give boost to Reeves – but it’s too early to get carried away
items.standfirst: While better-than-expected data for November offers hope for UK economy, clouds remain on the horizon• UK economy grew by better-than-expected despite budget uncertainty• Business live – latest updates• UK politics live – latest updatesAt the end of last year, Rachel Reeves was under fire for the impact of budget speculation on Britain’s economy. All of the noise about fiscal holes, tax increases and spending cuts before her late November budget was having a real-world effect on the spending decisions of households and businesses.The latest official figures will therefore come as a boost for the chancellor. Britain’s economy grew more strongly than expected in November, up 0.3%, despite the fog of uncertainty in the lead up to her critical tax and spending speech at the end of the month. Continue reading...

All of the noise about fiscal holes, tax increases and spending cuts before her late November budget was having a real-world effect on the spending decisions of households and businesses.The latest official figures will therefore come as a boost for the chancellor. Britain’s economy grew more strongly than expected in November, up 0.3%, despite the fog of uncertainty in the lead up to her critical tax and spending speech at the end of the month. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The U.K. economy grew by a more-than-expected 0.3% in November, data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed Thursday. items.title: TSMC Says Spending to Surge in Strong Signal for AI Boom
items.standfirst: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. surpassed $100 billion in annual revenue for the first time in 2025 and expects capital spending to surge to as much as $56 billion in 2026. The stronger-than-anticipated projection signals its confidence in the longevity of the global AI boom. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Robert Lea breaks down the numbers.
